summary: JXPath vulnerable to remote code execution when interpreting untrusted XPath expressions
details:
Those using JXPath to interpret untrusted XPath expressions may be vulnerable to a remote code execution attack. All JXPathContext class functions processing a XPath string are vulnerable except `compile()` and `compilePath()` function. The XPath expression can be used by an attacker to load any Java class from the classpath resulting in code execution.

## Example vulnerable code
Following code will execute the RCE in `pathWithUserInput` variable:
- `new JXPathContext(someObject).getValue(pathWithUserInput);`
- `new JXPathContext(someObject).iterate(pathWithUserInput);`

## Proof of concept
Spring application with vulnerable endpoint:
- [CVE-2022-41852 Proof of Concept](https://github.com/Warxim/CVE-2022-41852)

## Solutions and workarounds
1. Do not allow use of untrusted input in XPath parameters.
2. Disable functions in JXPathContext by replacing functions with empty function library:
`context.setFunctions(new FunctionLibrary());`
